content.label: This game is so tantalizing and genius, it’d be crazy to give it a rating lower than 5! I love it!

Just absolutely amazing. Graphics, gameplay, story. Also scared me
half to death because I’m a wimp.

The game has a great story and is very worth playing till the end. I would give it 5 if they had continued the story and not leave some plot holes. It looks amazing and doesn’t disappoint with great puzzles and a mind boggling story. The reason it is also sad is (SPOILER WARNING) you get to know the character and to kind have a sense of her unsettling circumstance. It was sad when she thought she was leaving and them got shot at the end. But over all a very nice story, good job. 4/5
Installed, uninstalled, restarted iPad Pro, reinstalled the game and it’s still stuck on the splash screen. I need my money back!

It’s definitely unique and obviously well made but I was pretty bored from the beginning and super frustrated because it makes you think you’re on the right track while actually being way off. I play A LOT of puzzle games (practically all I’ve played since childhood) and this boring game had me stumped from the beginning. I gave it two tries and couldn’t get through the first puzzle without a walkthrough. That’s not fun. It’s just a waste of my precious little game time.
The only problem is I wish this game were longer! The graphics are absolutely stunning and it is just challenging enough to be addictive. Really beautiful game.
Interesting idea, well implemented. Bravo Simogo!

Device 6 tells one of the most interesting stories I’ve read, making full use of the form of electronic literature and telling a story that would be impossible to tell in any other medium. Without reservations, I highly recommend everyone should read/play this.

I've been a hard core computer user for over fifty years. I can count the computer games I've enjoyed playing on the fingers of one hand. Adventure, Portal, Myst, Monument Valley. And now Device 6.  Seriously, is that different, that clever and that entertaining.

I really don’t see what all the hype was about. I found this game to be boring and unfulfilling. Like reading while spinning your phone in circles? Hey, maybe this is for you. It tries so hard to be weird just for the sake of being weird, and I got bored with it very quickly.

Device 6 freezes on launch screen (red device6 logo screen) on my iPad Pro 9.7” inch . Devs please Fix (both year walk and device 6 freezing on launch on my iPad Pro even after latest recent  patch on wed. Nov. 22nd 2017) edit: fixed after following dev’s advice to disable display zoom mode, both year walk and device6 now are working. Thanks devs.
Game is amazing!

title.label: Fantastic game (is even better on iPhone X)

content.label:
The devs have updated both this and Year Walk with iPhone X support, and boy am I glad. 

Both titles are outstanding games made even better on the iPhone X’s larger screen. Incredibly immersive on any decide, Device 6 is a game that deserves your time and attention (and money).

Buy it now, go in blind, and enjoy the ride -  you’re in for a great experience.

Special thanks to Simogo for the quick update supporting new hardware and going the extra mile with the fix; no ugly black bars or poor cropping make this a must-have game on your shiny new iPhone X. 

Don’t miss out on one of the best mobile games out there!

My previous review is below for posterity’s sake.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Don’t buy this game (yet).

Let me explain.

I always loved Device 6 on my old iPhone, so imagine my disappointment when I unwrap my iPhone X, download Device 6, launch the game, and... nothing happens. Stuck on the launch screen with then game’s logo and no ability to interact or move forward.

I want to love this game, and I hate giving a one-star review, but unfortunately for now that’s my only real option - I’m left with an expensive icon, and that’s it. The same thing happened to me with Year Walk.

Devs, please update this game. I hear nothing but good things about it, but as of now I can’t say I agree.

I look forward to updating this review with a new (working) version of the game.
Immersing and engaging. Great concept.

Opens up to a splash screen and then just freezes

Edit: still doesn't work after most recent update even though developer said they were working on update to fix this issue

Edit2: after the most recent update the device works on iPhone x. Really great game, requires you to think outside of the box
There’s no instructions whatsoever, you can only play with sound on, and it’s not necessarily a game, more like a children’s book.

The concept, art, and music were interesting and original, (which is why it’s getting two stars instead of one,) but the game's execution was lacking. The plot was superficial and basic at best, and there was no emotional investment in the protagonist, Anna. Shouldn’t we care about what happens to her? By the end, I was bored and just wanted it to be over. 

Some puzzles were easy and some were so obscure that I had to look up solutions. It took the better part of a day to beat, but unfortunately has no replay value unless they release more chapters (but it’s highly unlikely given the ending). 

To be honest, I expected a better game from all the rave reviews. Is this what passes as “genius” these days?
It’s all I want
Simply put - absolutely amazing. Well crafted, innovative experiential design and a great use of the touch/mobile platform. This is what it means to create something new.

Tried closing and reopening the app very often but it’s just stuck on the starting “device 6” screen.
I’m on iPhone X.

title.label: Does not work on iphone 7 plus

content.label: Simply, does not work on iphone 7 plus. Requesting refund
I had lots of fun with DEVICE 6 but I would most certainly not put it in the category of games.
Great game. Won’t work on iphone x.

title.label: Hard for first timer but great game

content.label: I don’t really play many video games. Was looking for something different and engaging when I was sick a while back. Never played anything like this and it is super interesting and beautifully done. It was hard! For me at least.
I don’t have the correct words to give this game enough praise. It was a bit short, so I wanted more but everything about it was simply an amazing experience.
Challenging, even though the answers are right there.

title.label: None of this company’s games work on X

content.label: I bought this and End Year and neither will make it past the black screen. I hope i don’t have issues getting my money back!
Seriously mind blown. Didn’t expect this at all and I loved it. I love puzzles and mystery novels and this was the best of both!
A gliding first-person narrative-em-up adventure.
You make a game this interesting and only make 6 puzzles/chapters!!?? Amazing game but couldn’t you add more?
Using iOS 11.02 and won’t get past the title screen. Money back, please.

The Game Device 6 is TRULY THE BEST GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYED! The game does require you to read, but I assure you it is WORTH IT. The plot is very well written, flawless, unpredictable, mysterious, eerie and puzzling. The graphics were on point. The game really allowed you to think deep in an enticing way. No matter the outcome, you won't be able take your mind off the story. Truly remarkable, and a bargain for what it should be worth! The music was catchy and definitely set the tone and mood of the story, I want the playlist! The way the game interacted with YOU, as the reader, was THE BEST EVER. But!!! The game was too short! There needs to be MORE MORE MORE!

This is a spectacular text and audio puzzle game. It's completely immersive, almost hypnotic. The playing style is unique and the story and puzzles are clever. I loved it and just wish there was more of it! Maybe in VR...! All puzzle gamers must play this game immediately!

This game isn't worth $0.99.

The puzzles are not fun.  The interface is horrifically clunky.  The sound is unlevel and pretty much unpleasant through the entire game.  The graphics - what graphics there are - aren't in the least attractive.  The story is contrived and moronic with no character personality or development.  The atmosphere is disgusting, not thrillingly spooky.  And the oh-so-clever twist of the player being a part of the events of the game is neither all that original nor well implemented.

While playing, I could practically see the designers of this game giving themselves undeserved pats on their backs for this trite, shallow story told through annoying gameplay.  Clearly they thought they were being frightfully clever and witty.  They weren't.  Device 6 is nothing more than a typical room escape game with arbitrary puzzles, the only difference being that Device 6 has a mucked up interface.

Why are so many people so misguided as to laud to the skies any game that breaks game design conventions?  Entrenched game design conventions became entrenched game design conventions BECAUSE THEY WORK.

Different is NOT the same as Good.

This game is so confusing. I was given no directions on how to play and the just started me off reading. Makes no sense to me. Also it has to be played WITH sound turned on so if u want to play it in a quiet room like the library or at school, you have to put earbuds on. For 5 dollars this game is a no go. I am a teenager and don’t understand how to play so just throwing that out there. I’m pretty sure all you do is read so if ur into that stuff I guess this game would be good for you. I don’t really like to play games that 1. Start me off w/out directions and 2. I have to read with sound on. I know it doesn’t make sense to read with your sound on. But whatever here is an honest review for this game.

title.label: I don't understand how this has good reviews

content.label: This has to be one of the dumbest games I've played. The things between chapters were ridiculous. I finished the game hoping it would get better, but it was was too easy, annoying, and just bad the whole way through. Good thing it was cheap.

I guess if your brain works the way the developer's does you'll like this kind of game, but for me this was nothing but frustration. I spent 2 hours scrolling back and forth and am no closer to solving the first puzzle than I was when I started. I hate games that make me feel stupid, and this one does.

title.label: Does not work on iPad 12.9 inch

content.label: Purchased after hearing great things, but can't get past the title screen. I may have to ask for a refund.
It's amazing to play device6 download this immediately

For $0.99 this game is incredible. Only complaint is it is kind of short (easily beatable in a couple of hours) and there is little to no replay value. There is nothing else that matches the experience of going through this game though. Great idea, good story, and exceptional execution.
So creative and innovative. Truly the best puzzle game in my opinion

I bought this game on a whim, and I'm so glad I did. I am very, very impressed. This is one of the most innovative games I've played for the iPhone. Truly shows what gaming can be on a mobile device. Developer: make more of these!!
Loved the puzzles

I went into this game paying full price and not expecting much. It exceeded my expectations in every way, shape, form. I'd like to truly give a bravo to the app creators and I'll definitely be looking forward to playing your games in the future, no matter the cost. Great job again!
Great app, definitely worth the price.  Give it a shot!

I've been an Interactive Fiction fan for many years, and although this isn't traditional IF, it is a solid, mutant evolution into another generation of the genre.

Minimalist yet detailed, this is the first IOS game I've found that transcends the screen. Rather than drawing a player "into" the game, this actually feels as if it reaches out and envelops the player in a creepy, nihilistic future-punk environment centered by the device in your hand.

Don't fixate on the little details too much; they tend to be red herrings. It will take some out of the box thinking, and be sure to keep the sound up so you can hear important clues. 

There are six chapters, but the last two are particularly short. Disappointingly short, as I absolutely loved this game and hoped to continue the experience longer. 

Well worth the .99 that I paid for it, and was impressed enough with their work that I went ahead and purchased Year Walk and Sailor's Dream, as well. I'll be looking for more of their games, and really hope there's a "Device 7" or continuation of this excellent production.
This game is definately worth playing. If you love mystery and/or puzzles, you will definately LOVE this game.

I'm in awe! This was so amazing I can hardly put it to words! I love puzzles and I love reading. It mixed both and my curiosity was peaked. I delved into this so much I didn't stop until I finished! I wish it was longer. I hope more will come!!!
Did not like it at all. Thought this would be a nice game that would keep me entertained at work during downtimes, and I hate it.

I've never left a review for a game before.  But this game amazed me.  A twisted storyline, challenging puzzles. I loved this.  

So, when does my prize arrive?
